item> Hariyali Teej Fasting Rules 2023: Do's and Don'ts during fast Hariyal Teej is a significant Indian festival for married women, observed on August 19, 2023, in the northern states of India. Women wake up early, take a holy bath, adorn themselves in traditional attire, and offer prayers to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati for a happy marital life. Hariyal Teej is also celebrated in Radha Krishna temples with grandeur and enthusiasm. Women must not wear black, white, cream, or blue-colored clothes on this auspicious day and mustn't engage in any tamasik activity while following a sattvic lifestyle. Pregnant women can skip the fast but stay hydrated. https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/religion/festivals/hariyali-teej-fasting-rules-2023-dos-and-donts-during-fast/articleshow/102768546.cms https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/religion/festivals/hariyali-teej-fasting-rules-2023-dos-and-donts-during-fast/articleshow/102768546.cms 2023-08-16T15:44:00+05:30 author2@example.com (Author 2)
